Stagmeister: Sorry, this is likely very niche, but I just can't read the thread's title without seeing the following...

It's from the docks in the city of Hull on the east coast of the UK, and with a Humberside accent it sounds the same. When the warehouses were pulled down, a campaign was started to preserve Dead Bod, and it now resides in a museum (T-shirts and hats are commonly available), and is the unofficial emblem of the 2017 City of Culture.

This helps the build not one whit, but I'm sharing it anyway.

Cheers
The name of the build was originally "dead bard". This dude is made for dev crit environements. He's like brook  in one piece : dead, singing and powerful.

pros :
- unbuffed 40 AB  ;
- bard song (level 26) ; cursed song level 26 ;
- soon lasting inspiration (level 24) ;
- dev crit DC 40 (42 buffed) ;
- good AC ;
- PM immunities ;
- undispellable bard spells ;
- synergy between dark blessing and bard spells (charisma) ;
- taunt.

Cons : 
- low HP ;
- no epic spell.

posts.content:
Good build, you are immune to Dev Crit but you can deliver it with impunity.

A few minor suggestions: Take improved critical before great cleave & try not to fragment your pale master levels too much.
